burner:
burn= v 燃烧, 烧焦

burner=n 烤...的东西, 就是烤炉, 烤箱

-er表示...的东西或...的人
turn off:
turn on the switch/light/burner/TV

open是指把一个东西打开或关闭,
比如open the door/cabinet/gate

很多中文里边用"开"的词, 到英语中都是turn on, 而不是open, 注意一下

turn on=打开
turn off=关闭

Hand me:
hand me some water.
hand me a piece of paper
hand me your cellphone
those bowls:
bowl /boʊl/ 碗

plate=碟子
bowl=碗

美国的棒球比赛的总决赛称之为super bowl, 超级碗.

Fine: Fine在这里表示随你便, 而不是好吧, 它和sure表示的语气是不同的

He can have:
He can have a nice evening.
He can have a good job.
He can have a garden salad.

He can have 后边跟一个东西.
他可以有...
spaghetti primavera:
spaghetti [spə'ɡɛti]
意大利面
我们常常去意大利餐馆吃到的面就是这一种.
spaghetti是pasta的一种

pasta in the shape of long thin pieces that look like string when they are cooked.
/'priməverə/

garden salad:
['sæləd]
色拉
中文的色拉是音译

**garden salad是菜名, 里边有很多绿色的生菜.** 

A garden salad (also green salad) is a salad consisting mostly of fresh vegetables.
appetizer:
appetizer=开胃菜 ['æpə'taɪzɚ]
appetite=胃口 ['æpɪtaɪt]

吃西餐时, 因为正餐需要等很久, 往往会先吃一点开胃菜.

如果说你的胃口很好, 什么都能吃, 就可以说 You have a good appetite
a grilled fish:
grill= v 烤

**grill另外有一个意思是 烤肉用的那个铁架子.**

grill a fish=把一条鱼烤熟
a grilled fish=一条烤鱼

cheese:
cheese=奶酪
和我们之前学过的yogurt酸奶区分
外国人照相时常常说cheese, 因为说cheese的时候有种微笑的感觉
pasta:
pasta=/ˈpɑstə/  
n. 意大利面食
an Italian food made from flour, water, and sometimes eggs, formed into different shapes and usually served with a sauce.
pepper:
pepper['pɛpɚ]
胡椒, 辣椒

paper=纸
pepper=胡椒
注意区分

I'm not going to:
I'm not going to give up.
I'm not going to hand you those bowls.
I'm not going to turn off that burner.

I'm not going to后边跟一个动词,
表示我不会做某事, 我不愿意做某事

a moussaka special:
moussaka special的结构类似我们前边学到的hamburger special.

moussaka是一道希腊菜,肉末+茄子做成
special表示特色的或特价的

/'musakə/
